message: @audreyr, been thinking about a possible template refactor.  My initial look was at just pulling all the color references into a color.css file, and have classes for all the color use, so that elements would have a style class, and color class

I think the template refactor itself would not be that major, most of the template stuff is pretty agnostic.  It would be more about making sure the blocks skeleton is nice and diverse for other projects to be able to extend or override regions as needed.
But then I also was thinking that the templates could be factored a bit where it makes sense to have a packaginator base, and then djangopackages specific stuff
Hey @ptone, I was hoping I could get you to help me with the app/models refactor to remove PyPI and Repos from the Package app.
@ptone Do you think Sass (http://sass-lang.com/) might be good for the color refactor part?
I guess can be compiled in advanced and so isn't a true dep

As for the template refactor, be careful.  I did a major template un-refactor after Djangodash last year because I was frustrated with having to look in so many different blocks every time I wanted to make a template change.
I think it's better for users to override particular templates than to blockify all of them.
I thought of sass but was trying to KISS :)
if you are thinking of using Sass, look at Compass: http://compass-style.org/
I agree with  @akavlie take a look at compass since @audreyr  you like blueprint
And here is a link to shpaml http://shpaml.webfactional.com/ if interested
@audreyr haml "over sass" doesn't make much sense. Haml is for HTML while Sass is for CSS.
haml was strongly recommended by @dmpeters over sass. he says there's a py implementation of it too, spaml
